org.ow2.proactive.resourcemanager.frontend

Interface RMMonitoring

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RMMonitoringImpl

    @PublicAPI
public interface RMMonitoring
    An interface Front-End for the Monitoring of the Resource Manager. This interface provides a way for a monitor to ask at Resource Manager to throw events generated by nodes and nodes sources management.
    Since:
    ProActive Scheduling 0.9
    See Also:
    RMEventListener

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      RMInitialState addRMEventListener(RMEventListener listener, RMEventType... events)
      Register a new Resource manager listener.
      int getNeededNodes() 
      RMInitialState getState()
      Gets the current snapshot of the resource manager state providing detailed nodes and node source information.
      boolean isAlive()
      Deprecated. 
      void removeRMEventListener()
      Removes a listener from RMMonitoring.

    • Method Detail

      • isAlive

        @Deprecated
boolean isAlive()
        Deprecated. 
        ping the RM
        Returns:
        true if the RM is still alive

      • addRMEventListener

        RMInitialState addRMEventListener(RMEventListener listener,
                                  RMEventType... events)
        Register a new Resource manager listener. Way to a monitor object to ask at RMMonitoring to throw RM events to it.
        Parameters:
        listener - a listener object which implements RMEventListener interface.
        events - list of wanted events that must be received.
        Returns:
        RMInitialState snapshot of RM's current state : nodes and node sources.

      • removeRMEventListener

        void removeRMEventListener()
        Removes a listener from RMMonitoring. Only listener itself must call this method

      • getState

        RMInitialState getState()
        Gets the current snapshot of the resource manager state providing detailed nodes and node source information.
        Returns:
        the current state of the resource manager

      • getNeededNodes

        int getNeededNodes()
